baseRule.text: 若比丘得好美食乳酪魚肉。無病自為己索者。波逸提。四十
baseRule.label: Classical Chinese Dharmaguptaka Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40

fullParallels.text: Yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyathidaṁ—sappi, navanītaṁ, telaṁ, madhu, phāṇitaṁ, maccho, maṁsaṁ, khīraṁ, dadhi. Yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṁ.
fullParallels.label: Paḷī Theravāda Bhikkhu Pācittiya 39

translations.text: Es gibt solche vorzüglichen genießbaren Speisen, nämlich: Butteröl, Butter, Öl, Honig, Melasse, Fisch, Fleisch, Milch und Quark (Yoghurt). Welcher Mönch auch immer, ohne krank zu sein, um solche vorzügliche genießbare Speisen zum eigenen Verzehr bittet und sie (dann) genießt, muß dafür sühnen.

If a monk who is not sick asks for any of these kinds of fine foods for himself—that is, ghee, butter, oil, honey, syrup, fish, meat, milk, and curd—and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

Existen estos comestibles refinados: mantequilla clarificada, mantequilla, aceite, miel, azúcar/melaza, pescado, carne, leche y cuajada. Si un bhikkhu que no está enfermo, pide este tipo de comestibles refinados para sí mismo y los consume: [La acción] ha de ser confesada

fullParallels.text: 若比丘。諸家中如是美食。乳酪生酥熟酥油魚肉脯。若比丘無病。如是美食為身索。波夜提。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Sarvāstivāda Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40

fullParallels.text: 若比丘不病。為己乞乳酪生酥魚肉脯者。波夜提。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Sarvāstivāda Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40

fullParallels.text: 若復苾芻如世尊說上妙飲食乳酪生酥魚及肉。若苾芻無病。為己詣他家乞取食者。波逸底迦。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Mūlasarvāstivāda Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40

fullParallels.text: 若諸家中有如是美食。乳酪酥油魚肉。若比丘無病為己索得食者。波逸提。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Mahīśāsaka Bhikkhu Pācittiya 41

fullParallels.text: 若比丘。不病為身乞酥油蜜石蜜乳酪魚肉。如是乞美食食者。波夜提。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Mahāsaṅghika Bhikkhu Pācittiya 39

fullParallels.text: 「若比丘！得好美飲食，乳、酪、魚、及肉，若比丘如此美飲食，無病，自為己索者，波逸提。四十
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Dharmaguptaka Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40

translations.text: If a monk obtain choice and tasty food, milk, cream, fish, flesh, or (not being sick) in his own person and for him self seek for such things, it is Pācittiya.
Jika seorang bhikṣu yang tidak sakit meminta makanan yang baik seperti susu, keju, ikan, atau daging untuk dirinya sendiri, ia melakukan sebuah pāyattika.

fullParallels.text: 若比丘得好美飲食。酥油蜜石蜜乳酪生酥。若魚若肉。無病為己索而食者。波逸提。
fullParallels.label: Classical Chinese Kāśyapīya Bhikkhu Pācittiya 40
